dt: {bc}not sponsored by or affiliated with an organization or authority

dt.t: The Seoul government reacted sternly to [Sun Myung] Moon's {wi}freelance{/wi} diplomacy, accusing him of {ldquo}causing a split in national opinion.{rdquo}

shortdef: of, relating to, or being a freelancer : independent
not sponsored by or affiliated with an organization or authority

dt.t: … after graduating from the Philadelphia College of Art, he [John Mecray] {wi}freelanced{/wi} as an illustrator and taught drawing classes at his alma mater.
For a while, as he looked about for another book subject, Mr. [Tracy] Kidder {wi}freelanced{/wi} articles for the Atlantic Monthly magazine.

shortdef: to act or work as a freelancer

dt: {bc}a person who pursues a profession without a long-term commitment to any one employer {bc}{sx|freelancer||}

dt.t: … the 42-year-old writer, who is now working on a book about Evelyn Waugh and his circle, described himself as a full-time {wi}freelance{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a mercenary soldier especially of the Middle Ages {bc}{sx|condottiere||}
{bc}a person who acts independently without being affiliated with or authorized by an organization (such as a political party)

dt.t: ran for office as a political {wi}free lance{/wi}
"Have you been making your addresses as a {wi}free lance{/wi} or under the auspices of the Speakers' Bureau … ?" she was asked.

shortdef: a person who pursues a profession without a long-term commitment to any one employer : freelancer
a mercenary soldier especially of the Middle Ages : condottiere
a person who acts independently without being affiliated with or authorized by an organization (such as a political party)
